title: build: Panic when testing  go1.3beta1 on  linux/arm (Raspberry Pi)
body:
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since the
latest release. Search the issue tracker and check that you're running the
latest version of Go:

Run "go version" and compare against
http://golang.org/doc/devel/release.html  If a newer version of Go exists,
install it and retry what you did to reproduce the problem.

Thanks.

What does 'go version' print?

go version devel +f8b50ad4cac4 Mon Apr 21 17:00:27 2014 -0700 + linux/arm

What steps reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.

1. Build go1.3beta1, (./all.bash) on the Raspberry Pi Model B.


What happened?
?   	cmd/objdump	[no test files]
panic: test timed out after 6m0s

goroutine 36 [running]:
runtime.panic(0x1124a8, 0x10424368)
	/home/pi/go1.3beta1/src/pkg/runtime/panic.c:279 +0x1a0
testing.func路008()
	/home/pi/go1.3beta1/src/pkg/testing/testing.go:628 +0x11c
created by time.goFunc
	/home/pi/go1.3beta1/src/pkg/time/sleep.go:121 +0x58

goroutine 16 [chan receive, 5 minutes]:

	/home/pi/go1.3beta1/src/pkg/testing/testing.go:435 +0x6c

	cmd/pack/_test/_testmain.go:57 +0x98

	/home/pi/go1.3beta1/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:1370 +0x40

	/home/pi/go1.3beta1/src/pkg/runtime/mgc0.c:2624 +0xa0

What should have happened instead?

clean build

Please provide any additional information below.
